text: Android is the world's most popular
mobile operating system and it is
powerful so I've collected my top five
favorite Android power user tips they'll
work across any Android phone as long as
it's running KitKat or higher number one
download the Google camera if you're not
happy with the camera on your Android
phone there's a good chance the Google
camera app can make it better it's free
and it adds features like lens blur
great panoramas and 360 degree photos
and on some cameras it can even improve
overall image quality you will miss some
of the advanced features that are in the
Android stock camera but Google camera
is super easy to use and definitely
worth a try
number two get Google Chrome to Phone
there are definitely benefits to being
in the Google universe as long as you're
willing to do a little bit of setup
first get the free Chrome to Phone
extension and install it in the Chrome
browser then get the free Chrome to
Phone app for your Android phone once
you're signed into Google you'll be able
to send map links phone numbers text all
of that straight to your phone so
imagine that you've looked up directions
on your computer you can send them to
your phone and they'll open up in Google
Maps it's pretty great number three
leave the fitness tracker at home
Android has built-in support for step
counting and motion detection so you
don't need a separate gadget to track
your activities you can download google
fit on most phones or phones like LG and
Samsung have full health Suites built
right in skip that ugly wearable number
four use your phone as a remote control
most new Android phones can remotely
control TVs cable boxes DVD players
basically anything that has infrared
some LG phones come with a really nice
built-in universal remote app and LG and
Samsung both have apps that control
their respective TVs you can find
universal remote apps on the Google Play
Store too but I recommend the paid apps
the free ones seem a little sketchy
and let's be honest you're a lot more
likely to lose the remote control than
you are to lose your phone
number five tips for lollipop once you
finally get Android 5.0 or lollipop
there are some changes you will want to
know for example if you swipe down once
from the top of the screen you now see
notifications and some google now cards
you have to swipe down twice to get to
your Quick Settings menu where you can
cast to a chromecast or put it in
airplane mode and that screen by the way
now includes a flashlight and the
settings finally get built-in search so
if you're looking for tethering or
notification all you have to do is type
in the first couple of letters next to
the magnifying glass and you can find
what you're looking for there's
obviously a lot more going on in
lollipop and I'm sure you'll find a lot
more tips if you do please send them to
me tweet me at Mollywood on twitter calm
